    • Method Detail

      • buySharesOfStock

        public void buySharesOfStock(java.util.Date date,
                             double amount,
                             java.lang.String symbol,
                             java.lang.String portfolioName)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: StockInvestmentStrategies

        This method allows trading of the stocks which includes certain shares(integer or fraction) for a given amount. Since the entire purpose of this interface is to make user understand about the stock investment, through this method, user can understand buying of stocks at a certain date which could be a past date. Date should also include the time in 24Hr format so that user explores various scenarios which could happen in actual trading (For Example, restricting user to not buying anything after stock exchange operation hours or on holidays.). Implementor is free to choose the strategy for selecting operation hours as per the exchange timings and timezone. If the user does not provide time, current time will be taken into consideration for today's date.

        Note that, user can buy shares for a given portfolio name. The minimum amount required for user to invest should be greater than 0.0. Along with the mentioned data, user must provide company ticker symbol which helps in identifying the stocks that user wants to buy. If any of these parameters are not as expected, the method should throw IllegalArgumentException.

        Specified by:
        buySharesOfStock in interface StockInvestmentStrategies
        Parameters:
        date - for which user needs to buy stock. It should be in "MM-dd-yyyy HH:mm:ss" format.
        amount - in double which describes total cost of investment of user for this purchase.
        symbol - unique company ticker symbol in String to identify stock of that company.
        portfolioName - name of the Portfolio in String for which user wants to buy stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case parameters provided are incorrect.

      • createPortfolio

        public IPortfolio createPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InvestmentStrategies
        Creates a new portfolio object for the provided portfolio name. User may provide suitable portfolio name serves the intend of keeping all relevant investment entities at same place. User has to provide a unique portfolio name which doesn't match with the existing one.
        Specified by:
        createPortfolio in interface InvestmentStrategies
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - unique value of the portfolio name in String.
        Returns:
        portfolio created by user of type IPortfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - in case portfolio with the provided name is already present.

      • getPortfolios

        public java.util.List<IPortfolio> getPortfolios()
        Description copied from interface: InvestmentStrategies
        Returns list of portfolio objects created by the user. The implementation should ensure that the original portfolio data structure is not modified.
        Specified by:
        getPortfolios in interface InvestmentStrategies
        Returns:
        collection of portfolios created by user of type IPortfolio.

      • viewPortfolio

        public IPortfolio viewPortfolio(java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Description copied from interface: InvestmentStrategies
        Provides a way for the user to check complete details of the portfolio for a given portfolio name.
        Specified by:
        viewPortfolio in interface InvestmentStrategies
        Parameters:
        portfolioName - name of the portfolio for which user wants to check details.
        Returns:
        an object of type IPortfolio containing composition of the same.

      • checkPortfolioStatus

        public java.lang.String checkPortfolioStatus(java.util.Date date,
                                             java.lang.String portfolioName)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: InvestmentStrategies
        At any given time, user may want to check the status of investment belonging to any portfolio. This method ensures the comparison of user investment cost at portfolio level with its value for the provided date. The implementation should ensure that only valid date is provided in the input. In case the date provided is non-working date, closing price for the previous working day should be taken into consideration for evaluating current portfolio value.
        Specified by:
        checkPortfolioStatus in interface InvestmentStrategies
        Parameters:
        date - for which portfolio needs to be checked.
        portfolioName - in String for which investment needs to be checked.
        Returns:
        portfolio Status represented as String.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case date is invalid or portfolio name is not found.
